item.title: Docker Basics
item.description: It has been quite a while! Some quick recipes on using Docker. Quite often, I need to test few thing in a controlled environment, nothing is easier than starting a virtual machine in interactive mode. For example, you can do: docker run -v $(pwd):/root -it ubuntu:latest /bin/bash This command will: run docker interactively (you will get a pseudo-tty with stdin) start an Ubuntu image mount the current directory in /root the container will be automatically removed if existing
